title: 536 God, Who Stretched the Spangled Heavens

lines: 1. God, who stretched the spangled heavens Infinite in time and place, Flung the suns in burning radiance Through the silent fields of space: We, Your children in Your likeness, Share inventive powers with You; Great Creator, still creating, Show us what we yet may do.

2. We have ventured worlds undreamed of Since the childhood of our race; Known the ecstasy of winging Through untravelled realms of space, Probed the secrets of the atom, Yielding unimagined power; Facing us with life's destruction Or our most triumphant hour.

3. As each far horizon beckons, May it challenge us anew: Children of creative purpose, Serving others, honouring You. May our dreams prove rich with promise; Each endeavour well begun; Great Creator, give us guidance Till our goals and Yours are one.
